meanings.definition: People who persuade others to do something through deception or flattery.
meanings.sent1: The inveiglers at the fair convinced people to play games with tricky words.
meanings.sent2: The inveiglers in the story tricked the main character into giving them all his money.
meanings.sent3: The group of inveiglers tried to sweet-talk the cat into sharing its fish.
meanings.sent4: The inveiglers were like sly foxes, luring unsuspecting victims into their traps.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the inveiglers, for their words are like honey masking a bitter truth.

meanings.definition: The act of persuading someone to do something through deception or flattery.
meanings.sent1: The success of the plan relied on the inveiglers' ability to manipulate others.
meanings.sent2: In the movie, the protagonist fell victim to the inveiglers' smooth talking.
meanings.sent3: The inveiglers' tactics were so obvious that even the children saw through them.
meanings.sent4: The world of politics is full of inveiglers who use charm to gain power.
meanings.sent5: The inveiglers' web of lies eventually unraveled, revealing their true intentions.
